item.title: Garden Waste Bin Dumped., 6th August
item.description:
There is a Brown garden waste bin that has been dumped in block of garages. There are no owner details attached. WhatThreeWords are even.bonus.puzzle. Can this be collected by the garden waste team please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eardley Road, Lessness Heath, London

item.title: Road sweeper needs to pass through around Plumstead Common, 6th August
item.description:
Roads haven't been cleaned in years. Dirt and rubbish just piled up and compacted along the road. Send in road sweepers or ask residents to move cars on a certain day if that's what it takes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plumstead Common Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass on road, 6th August
item.description:
Quite a lot of small shards of broken glass are on the road surface - probably left by the refuse collection this morning. I have tried to sweep up as much as possible myself but really there is a need for the street to be cleaned properly to avoid a lot of punctures to car and bicycle tyres...
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Maxted Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress and Headboard Dumped, 6th August
item.description:
Mattress and headboard dumped in alleyway between Church St and Oldfield Rd / Painsthorpe Rd. Previously reported twice (on 4 and 5 Aug) as fly tipping. On both occasions got message resolved. This is not correct. The items are still in the alleyway.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Defoe Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Safety fences from Pride Event still on street, 6th August
item.description:
These barriers used on July 5th have never been removed in spite of repeated requests by me and others. They're still blocking the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-3, Upper James Street, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet
